snippet: Showered with racist taunts, a player at an Italian exhibition led his team off the field — a first — and many hope that will have wide repercussions in sports.
abstract: Italians react forcefully to racist incident that led players with powerful AC Milan club to abandon soccer match, taking strong stand in country where racist episodes in sporting events are generally underplayed; exhibition match between AC Milan and Pro Patria was abruptly abandoned after Kevin-Prince Boateng, Ghanaian-German midfielder, responded to racist chants by kicking ball into stands where some Pro Patria supporters were howling like monkeys and then walked off the field, followed by his teammates.

byline.original: By ELISABETTA POVOLEDO and STEVEN ERLANGER
byline.contributor: Elisabetta Povoledo reported from Rome, and Steven Erlanger from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Showered with racist taunts, a player at an Italian exhibition led his team off the field — a first — and many hope that will have wide repercussions in sports.

headline.seo: Pro Patria Fans’ Racism Prompts A.C. Milan Walkout, and Outrage
headline.main: Soccer Racism Prompts Walkout, and Outrage
